section.title: Reset VM to New Root Disk on Reboot
section.para: You can specify that you want to discard the root disk and create a new one whenever a given VM is rebooted. This is useful for secure environments that need a fresh start on every boot and for desktops that should not retain state. The IP address of the VM will not change due to this operation.

para.emphasis: To enable root disk reset on VM reboot:

section.para: When creating a new service offering, set the parameter isVolatile to True. VMs created from this service offering will have their disks reset upon reboot. See .
